title: Experience-Based Learning Design for Entrepreneurship Capacity Building

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of foundational entrepreneurship theories and proficiency in digital tools
context.additional_context: A program for professionals in medical, legal, and technical fields to develop entrepreneurial competencies using digital devices, focusing on teamwork, experiential learning, goal-setting, and feedback skills

learning_goals: 80% or more of learners achieve a self-assessment score of 4 or higher (above average) in goal-setting abilities for entrepreneurship through experiential learning activities
Risk-taking tendencies improve by 20% or more compared to baseline (based on a 5-point Likert scale) through team-based projects
Learners score 75 or higher on formative assessments evaluating their ability to assess the feasibility of entrepreneurial ideas using quantitative analysis tools
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
